00044         #define KVIMODULEEXPORT extern "C" __declspec(dllexport) __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00045         #define KVIMODULEEXPORTDATA KVIMODULEEXPORT

00053 class KviModule;
00054 
00055 
00056 typedef bool (*KviModuleSystemRoutine)(KviModule *);
00057 typedef bool (*KviModuleCtrlRoutine)(KviModule *,const char *,void *);
00058 
00059 
00060 typedef struct _KviModuleInfo
00061 {
00062         const char * szKVIrcVersion;    // must match KVI_VERSION if module version checking is in force
00063         const char * szModuleName;      // module name
00064         const char * szModuleContext;   // name of the translation catalogue (if any)
00065         const char * szVersion;
00066         const char * szCopyright;
00067         const char * szDescription;
00068         /*
00069         * This routine is called when the module is loaded
00070         */
00071         KviModuleSystemRoutine init_routine;
00072         /*
00073         * This should return true if the module is actually
00074         * not providing any service and can be unloaded from memory.
00075         * Please note that this is not a mandatory lock: KVIrc may still unload
00076         * the module even when this function returns false.
00077         * The only assumption you can make is that KVIrc will not try
00078         * to unload the module spontaneously: it will do it only if forced to
00079         * (actually only by the user, but maybe later also by constrained resources).
00080         * If this pointer is zero, KVIrc will assume that the module
00081         * does not provide any service and will unload the module at the
00082         * first spontaneous cleanup.
00083         * There is a yet stronger locking method in KviModule::lock()
00084         */
00085         KviModuleSystemRoutine can_unload;
00086         /*
00087         * This is a generic control routine with prototype
00088         * bool <name>(KviModule * m,const char * operation,void * param)
00089         * KVIrc uses it to comunicate with bundled modules
00090         * in most user-build modules this will be 0
00091         */
00092         KviModuleCtrlRoutine   ctrl_routine;
00093         /*
00094         * This routine is called when the module is being unloaded
00095         * Note that the module can be unloaded even if can_unload returns false:
00096         * that's the user choice, KVIrc can only forcibly unload the module,
00097         * so better cleanup everything here :)
00098         */
00099         KviModuleSystemRoutine cleanup_routine; // WARNING : g_pApp may be in the destructor and may have no frames open!
00100 } KviModuleInfo;
00101 
00102 // NOTE: The init and cleanup routines should NEVER rely on g_pApp existing!
00103 //       so only "initialization and cleanup INTERNAL to the module" goes there!
00104 
00105 // A module should be prepared to be unloaded at ANY time, even if it is locked
00106 // or if can_unload returns false; locking is only a "suggestion" to the KVIrc core.
00107 
00108 // When unloaded, a module must ensure the destruction of all the resources that depend
00109 // on the module core code
00110 
00111 #define KVIRC_MODULE_STRUCTURE_SYMBOL "KVIrc_module_info"
00112 
00113 #define KVIRC_MODULE(_szModuleName,_szVersion,_szCopyright,_szDescription,_init_routine,_can_unload,_ctrl_routine,_cleanup_routine,_szModuleContext) \
00114         \
00115         KVIMODULEEXPORTDATA KviModuleInfo KVIrc_module_info= \
00116         { \
00117                 KVI_VERSION, \
00118                 _szModuleName, \
00119                 _szModuleContext, \
00120                 _szVersion, \
00121                 _szCopyright, \
00122                 _szDescription, \
00123                 _init_routine, \
00124                 _can_unload, \
00125                 _ctrl_routine, \
00126                 _cleanup_routine \
00127         };
00128 
00129 class KVIRC_API KviModule : public KviKvsModuleInterface
00130 {
00131         friend class KviPointerHashTable<const char *,KviModule>;
00132         friend class KviModuleManager;
00133         friend class KviUserParser;
00134 protected:
00135         KviModule(QLibrary* handle,KviModuleInfo * info,const QString &name,const QString &filename);
00136 public:
00137         ~KviModule(); // must be public for KviPointerList
00138 private:
00139         QString                                    m_szName;
00140         QString                                    m_szFileName;
00141         KviModuleInfo                            * m_pModuleInfo;
00142         QLibrary                                 * m_pLibrary;
00143         unsigned int                               m_uLock;
00144         long int                                   m_lastAccessTime;
00145 protected:
00146         void updateAccessTime();
00147         unsigned int secondsSinceLastAccess();
00148 public:
00149         // name of this module: always low case , single word
00150         const QString & name(){ return m_szName; };
00151         // filename of this module (with NO path): formatted as "libkvi%s.so",name()
00152         const QString & filename(){ return m_szFileName; };
00153         QLibrary*   handle(){ return m_pLibrary; };
00154         KviModuleInfo * moduleInfo(){ return m_pModuleInfo; };
00155 
00156         //
00157         // This is a locking method a bit stronger than the can_unload routine
00158         // in the descriptor. It will behave in the same way plus
00159         // the user will be unable to unload the module unless he will specify
00160         // the -f switch to the <module>.unload command. Without the -f switch
00161         // he will be just warned that the module is locked in memory and
00162         // don't want to be unloaded.
00163         // The usage of this method is encouraged
00164         // only when you have blocking dialogs inside the module code, like the
00165         // QMessageBox or QFileDialog static methods.
00166         // In this case you're entering a modal event loop that you can't control
00167         // and if some script will attempt to forcibly unload the module
00168         // it will surely lead to a crash when the static method returns (jumping into no mans land).
00169         // <module>.unload -f is in fact undocumented so people will substantially
00170         // not use it (unless they are developers and they are reading this comment).
00171         //
00172         void            lock(){ m_uLock++; };
00173         void            unlock(){ if(m_uLock > 0)m_uLock--; };
00174         bool            isLocked(){ return (m_uLock > 0); };
00175 
00176         void          * getSymbol(const char * symname);
00177         bool            ctrl(const char * operation,void * param);
00178 
00179         void getDefaultConfigFileName(QString &szBuffer);
00180 
00181         static void unregisterMetaObject(const char * metaObjName);
00182 
00183 #ifdef COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00184         void registerCryptEngine(KviCryptEngineDescription * d);
00185         void unregisterCryptEngine(const char * szName);
00186         void unregisterCryptEngines();
00187 #endif
00188 
00189         KviModuleExtensionDescriptor * registerExtension(const KviStr &szType,const KviStr &szName,const QString &szVisibleName,KviModuleExtensionAllocRoutine r);
00190         KviModuleExtensionDescriptor * registerExtension(const KviStr &szType,const KviStr &szName,const QString &szVisibleName,KviModuleExtensionAllocRoutine r,const QPixmap &icon);
00191         KviModuleExtensionDescriptor * findExtensionDescriptor(const KviStr &szType,const KviStr &szName);
00192         void unregisterAllExtensions();
00193 };

00195 #endif //_KVI_MODULE_H_
